result.execSummary:
The defendant Keelen M McAdoo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 9/5/2017 or civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work and school.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keelen M McAdoo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

As to Count 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

As to Count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Defendant ordered to serve 30 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 1 day time served, and with Huber Privileges for work and school.

Defendant ordered to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 9-05-2017 or civil judgment.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postonviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense has just received the negotiation and request an adjournment.    Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 33.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Keelen M McAdoo not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has picked up a new case.  Defense is in the process of negotiations with State.  Court will accept the transfer of the new case for global resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendants appearance previously waived. Case heard off the record. Defense advised DPA court will accept this case. Case is to be transferred to branch 6 for DPA. Case adjourned to branch 6.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests case transferred to branch 6 for DPA with other cases. Cases being staffed at 12:00 pm today. Court preapproved transfer of case to branch 6. Court passed case to this afternoon. If transfer approved, defendant's appearance to be waived this afternoon.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with Mark M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Keelen M McAdoo in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
